channel.title: Papers and Publications on The Bonetrade Project
channel.description: Recent content in Papers and Publications on The Bonetrade Project

item.title: Slides: Public Lecture @ York University, What the Machine Saw
item.description: what the machine saw: Studying the trade in human remains in an era of big data Shawn Graham Carleton University @electricarchaeo follow along at bit.ly/ Note: Would begin with territorial acknowledgement, if I was in Canada. But the material I study is traded through the internet; the trade transgresses borders, it transgresses time. So I will acknowledge the land on which Carleton stands. Because those people: those people have had their ancestors bought and sold.

item.title: Slides: Investigating and Policing Antiquities Trafficking and Forgery in a Digital Age
item.description: teaching machines to see like archaeologists neural networks, and the antiquities trades Shawn Graham @electricarchaeo follow along at bit.ly/sg-apr25 which presumes we know how archaeologists see Note: Sara Perry https://eprints.soton.ac.uk/344699/ narrator: we don’t Note: perry, hamilakis on vision, seeing, reification roopika risam on the kinds of humans our visualizations etc permit grounded & ungrounded antiquities try to talk about connaisseurship pompeian wall styles human remains

item.title: Slides: Workshop on Quantitative Analysis and the Digital Turn in Historical Studies
item.description: What Am I Looking At? Computer Vision, Digital Phrenology, and the Trade in Human Remains Shawn Graham @electricarchaeo follow along at bit.ly/sg-ut2019 Note: - late 19th century & scientific racism - human zoos & the human cost Abraham Ulrikab Note: - Abraham Ulrikab - Moravian Christians in Labrador. Convinved to come to Europe to be part of a human zoo, because Abraham trusted, wanted to see Europe.

item.title: Slides: Cultural Property Crime Seminar
item.description: fleshing out the bones understanding the human remains trade with computer vision Shawn Graham & Damien Huffer @electricarchaeo @DamienHuffer follow along at j.mp/sg-dh-qm18 Note: - late 19th century & scientific racism - human zoos & the human cost Abraham Ulrikab Note: - Abraham Ulrikab - Moravian Christians in Labrador. Convinved to come to Europe to be part of a human zoo, because Abraham trusted, wanted to see Europe.
